title: Append is Associative
description:
Prove that list append (`++`) is associative: the grouping of three appended lists does not matter.

**Goal:** `forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 l3 : list A), (l1 ++ l2) ++ l3 = l1 ++ (l2 ++ l3)`

This is one of the most important properties of lists, used as a lemma in many other proofs.
hints: The base case: `([] ++ l2) ++ l3 = [] ++ (l2 ++ l3)` simplifies directly
In the inductive case, `simpl` reduces the `::` head, then use `rewrite` with the induction hypothesis

solution:
Theorem app_assoc_manual : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 l3 : list A),
  (l1 ++ l2) ++ l3 = l1 ++ (l2 ++ l3).
Proof.
  intros A l1 l2 l3.
  induction l1 as [| x l1' IH].
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. rewrite IH. reflexivity.
Qed.
